data.title: The Black Crowes
data.meta_description: The Black Crowes artist page: interviews, features and/or performances archived at NPR Music
data.text:
The Black Crowes reignite their passion for rock on 'Happiness Bastards'

WXPN

The Atlanta rock band return with their first album in over a decade.

The Black Crowes on World Cafe

Listen Â· 27:38 27:38

The Black Crowes' Robinson Brothers Reunite As Brothers Of A Feather

WXPN

Rich and Chris Robinson talk about what led up to the decision to end the band in 2015, and perform live as an acoustic duo.

Brothers of a Feather on World Cafe

45:43

The Black Crowes: Tiny Desk Concert

Chris and Rich Robinson revisit songs from their debut album, Shake Your Money Maker.

Chris Robinson Brotherhood On World Cafe

WXPN

The band, formed after The Black Crowes' breakup, plays in a roots-oriented style it calls "California music."

Chris Robinson Brotherhood On World Cafe

24:35

Review: Dave Cobb's 'Southern Family' Compilation

The producer and guitarist presides over a graceful concept album in which some of country and Americana's biggest stars reflect on home.

The Black Crowes: 'Warpaint' Unplugged

WFUV

Much has been made of the relationship between brothers Chris and Rich Robinson of The Black Crowes. When the two arrived separately, it didn't dispel the rumors, but it turns out they just needed to go different places afterward. In a session from WFUV, the duo performs acoustic versions of new songs.

Hear an interview and performance from WFUV
